CatDescriptText: Miss Myrna Lee, 3301 Iowa Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 13, 1958, pg. 2 with question: �What do you think of young men or boys who process their hair? Do you think it improves their appearance or not?� answer reads: �Processing definitely does not improve the appearance of those who have it.  If the young men and boys do not have good hair they should keep it neat and cut short.  Personally, I don�t like it, period.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Myrna Lee, wearing dark short sleeved dress with graphic pattern, light colored collar, and flower at neckline, carrying eyeglasses, dark handbag, and wrapped rectangular package, standing in front of large rectangular stone block wall
